summary: The Border Water Quality Restoration and Protection Act focuses on improving water quality along the U.S.-Mexico border, specifically addressing pollution in the Tijuana River and New River. It establishes programs, grants, and action plans to address wastewater, stormwater, and infrastructure needs, including natural and green infrastructure.  The bill aims to coordinate efforts between the U.S. and Mexico, as well as various federal, state, and local agencies to restore and protect the environment and public health in the border region.
